thread.title: Man Utd injury news: Wayne Rooney and Phil Jones doubts for EFL Cup final | Metro News
thread.title_full: Man Utd injury news: Wayne Rooney and Phil Jones doubts for EFL Cup final | Metro News

author: Simon Rice For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Man Utd injury news: Wayne Rooney and Phil Jones doubts for EFL Cup final | Metro News

organizations.name: metro news simon rice for metro.co.uk

text:
Simon Rice for Metro.co.uk Monday 20 Feb 2017 10:53 am Wayne Rooney in training with Michael Carrick (Getty) 
Manchester United manager Jose Mourinho has revealed that Wayne Rooney and Phil Jones are injury doubts for the EFL Cup final after stating both are unlikely to feature in the Europa League tie with St Etienne this week. 
However there was better news on David De Gea and Antonio Valencia, with Mourinho confirming they were simply rested for the FA Cup victory over Blackburn on Sunday. Theo Walcott left red-faced as Arsenal fans slam club for 'disrespectful' gesture 
It’s a huge week for the Red Devils, with Europa League progress on the line on Wednesday and then an opportunity to win silverware when they take on Southampton at Wembley on Sunday. With such a huge game at the weekend Mourinho may be tempted to keep some of his stars out of harm’s way for the trip to France, particularly considering his side hold a 3-0 advantage over St Etienne from the first leg. 
Providing an injury update after the 2-1 win over Blackburn, Mourinho said: ‘De Gea was rested. Rooney is injured. Jones is injured. I don’t think they will recover [to face Saint-Etienne on Wednesday]. Valencia was rested but Rooney and Jones haven’t trained with the team yet so I don’t think they will be there for Wednesday.’ Manchester United fixtures 
St-Etienne – Europa (A) – Wed 22 Feb Southampton – EFL (N) – Sun 26 Feb Bournemouth (H) – Sat 4 Mar Southampton (A) – Sun 12 Mar Middlesbrough (A) – Sun 19 Mar West Brom (H) – Sat 1 Apr
